results.title: Energy efficient air
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John R. Hipwell, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as one of a series of videos commissioned by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria, this video looks at ways commercial building owners, operators and managers can save energy and the environment. This episode looks at practical ways to reduce the energy consumption of air conditioning systems.

results.title: The Energy audit
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John R. Hipwell, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as part of a series of videos outlining practical ways to measure energy use in commercial buildings, this video concentrates on conducting an energy audit. In turn, this will help the building manager in completing an energy management program with the aim of identifying opportunities for energy cost saving.

results.title: The Energy management program
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John R. Hipwell, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
This video is part of “The Energy management program” commissioned by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria. In this episode interviews are conducted with energy managers who have proven they can reduce costs while at the same time improving building comfort and helping the environment.

results.title: Energy efficient light
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John R. Hipwell, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as one of a series of videos commissioned by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria, this video looks at ways commercial building owners, operators and managers can save energy and the environment. This episode looks at lighting consumption and illumination, lamps, lighting and luminairies. Control systems are explored as well as effective strategies for improving the efficiency of existing systems and energy efficient alternatives.

results.title: The Dilemma: a child sexual abuse training package for doctors
results.creator_credit: Fiona Cochrane, John R. Hipwell, Film Victoria, Community Services Victoria and HIPS Film and Video Productions
results.brief_description: Designed to assist general practitioners to appropriately identify and manage their response to child abuse and neglect focussing on one general practitioners response to a case of child sexual abuse. Accompanied by a 27p. User’s Guide.

results.title: Free shadow movies
results.brief_description: Like a filmic haiku, this very short film is a series of observations of the ‘free shadow movies’ that play on the streets of everyday life. Gathering images of light, time and motion from the most simple moments - a passing train, children playing - the filmmaker has created an immersion into urban mysteries of shadow and sensation. The result, while simple and modest, is a hypnotic perception of street life as glimpsed from the corners of the eye.

results.title: Bali II: paradise isle
results.brief_description: Bali II described as a “gem of the Dutch East Indies”. This travelogue concentrates on the traditions of Bali - its agriculture and markets, and cultural practices.

results.title: Big painter
results.brief_description: A chronological study of the production of a mural by John Firth-Smith begun in 1978 and completed in 1981. The huge painting measures 6m x 48m and hangs in the headquarters of the ANZ Bank, Melbourne.
